articles.author: Miriam Kuepper
articles.title: More celebrities including Jennifer Aniston fight for justice for innocent black teen Ralph Yarl - Daily Mail
articles.description: Jennifer Aniston was the latest celebrity to demand justice for the teenager and explained what happened to the 16-year-old in a series of Instagram Stories on Monday.
articles.content: Jennifer Aniston joined other celebrities who have demanded justice for Ralph Yarl, the innocent black teenager who was shot twice when he accidentally rang the wrong doorbell - as his GoFundMe page … [+6418 chars]

articles.author: Catherine Shoard
articles.title: Morgan Freeman says the terms ‘Black History Month’ and ‘African American’ are insults - The Guardian
articles.description: The actor objected in a UK interview to both, saying ‘You’re going to relegate my history to a month?’ and that the latter phrase is inaccurate
articles.content: Morgan Freeman has said commonly used terms relating to race should be taken out of the lexicon. In an interview with the Sunday Times, the actor said he was keen to say publicly that he objected to … [+2708 chars]

articles.description: It's arguably Netflix's raciest and most scandalous season to date.
articles.content:

articles.title: Drake and The Weeknd AI song pulled from Spotify and Apple - BBC
articles.description: The song, which cloned the stars' voices, is removed from streaming platforms after a copyright claim.
